conclusion: Average kinetic energy of gas molecules is directly proportional to temperature.
Transition from D to A is a vertical line on the P-V diagram, indicating constant volume.
Process D to A is isochoric, meaning pressure is directly proportional to temperature.
Pressure at A is higher than pressure at D on the P-V diagram.
Since pressure at A is higher than at D, temperature at A is higher than at D.
Average kinetic energy at A is greater than at D, indicating an increase.
Average kinetic energy of gas molecules increases from D to A.
